name: Major Lazer - Lazer Dubs 7"
description: Super limited 7" digital dub version of Major Lazer's "Jah No Partial" done by a mysterious remixer. Only 300 copies pressed, with vocal and dub version on the flip.

name: V/A - NICE UP! vs Maximum Sound: Jungle Soundclash EP 12"
description:
Another dancefloor essential from the NICE UP! crew and without a doubt the biggest selection of legendary vocalists we've ever has the opportunity to work with!! As part of an exclusive hook up with iconic reggae label Maximum Sounds, who this year celebrate 20 years in the business, label owner and producer Frenchie entrusted NICE UP! head honcho Shep to delve into the vaults to rework some classics for this Jungle Soundclash EP.

First up, Belgium's Turntable Dubbers take on the mighty Bounty Killer and Lukie D on the classic Intercom riddim, creating a monstrous drum & bass anthem that will slay any soundsystem. Then it's Portugal's Ricky Tuff's turn to ramp up a selection of vocalists including Mr Vegas, Burro Bantan, Carl Meeks & Fuzzy Jones on the Sound Exterminata riddim - total sound boy destruction!

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F12803261&auto_play=false&show_artwork=true&color=ff7700"></iframe>

name: Dirty Dubsters ft Chip Fu & Screechy Dan 12"
description:
Dublin's other finest export the Dirty Dubsters make their first team debut on NICE UP! following a selection of tunes on their own Irish Moss imprint. Teaming up with rap innovator and member of the legendary Fu-Schnickens (responsible for dabbling with reggae & hip hop very early on with tunes such as the classic "Ring The Alarm") Chip Fu delivers his trademark fast-chat over a skanking reggae beat. Another legend of the 90s NY hip hop/reggae scene Screechy Dan also jumps on the track to make this a killer old-meets-new collaboration.

Remixes come from Chopstick Dubplate (aka new school jungle dons Jacky Murda & Aries) who drop a killer ragga jungle refix that will destroy any dance, plus label head honcho Shepdog flexes his studio muscles with a 90s dancehall inspired rework.

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F9863683&auto_play=false&show_artwork=true&color=ff7700"></iframe>

name: Mr Benn ft Tenor Fly - "No More Guns" 7"
description:
Following the success of his debut album "Shake A Leg", Mr Benn follows up with another single - this time featuring veteran dancehall/jungle MC Tenor Fly. A heavy roots infused reggae track with a deeper message, telling the story of a youth killed on the streets of Brixton and calling for an end to gun crime on the streets of the UK.

With plays already from Daddy G (Massive Attack), Mungo's Hi Fi and Don Letts, this is sure to become an anthem. 7" vinyl with version on the flip.

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F9542728%3Fsecret_token%3Ds-p66i4&auto_play=false&show_artwork=true&color=ff7700"></iframe>

name: Blend Mishkin ft Peppery "Foundation Style" 7"
description:
Brand new 7" from number one soundboy Blend Mishkin. A bouncing  hip hop/dancehall crossover with JA's Peppery aka Bongo Chilli on vocals.

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7600712&auto_play=false&show_artwork=true&color=ff7700"></iframe>

name: Inna NICE UP! Fashion 7"
description: Following the success of the Record Store Day collaboration with the legendary Fashion Records, NICE UP! return with another 2 classic cuts from the vaults - remixed and refashioned for 2013! First up, East London's Wrongtom takes time out of his packed schedule to rework the massive "Incredible" by General Levy. Universally loved, very few people know it was originally recorded as a dancehall number, then later remixed in a jungle style by M-Beat for chart success around the globe. It is a tune that has traversed genres and ages and still smashes any dance to this day. Wrongtom takes it back to the source with a fresh bumping reggae riddim featuring live instrumentation and his trademark dub fx. Over on the flip, rising star of the reggae world Mr Benn gives his spin on the modern dancehall sound with a dancefloor pleasing remix of Cutty Ranks "As You See It". Probably one of Cutty's lesser known tracks, this also found its home in the jungle raves of the mid 90s when sampled extensively by the producers of the day. Taking his cues from classic 90s dancehall producers such as Dave Kelly, and Bobby Digital, this remix showcases the producers talents perfectly. Inna NICE UP! Fashion 02 by NICEUPrecords

name: Mark Professor - "Oystah Card" 7"
description: The debut release from Wrongtom's Rongorock label on a similar cut to his recent remix for General Levy's "Incredible" on NICE UP!/Fashion. Wreck It Up mic man Mark Professor lays down some wicked vocals extolling his Oyster Card and London's transport network. With a Version on the flip. ***EACH ORDER COMES WITH A FREE NICE UP! OYSTER CARD HOLDER***

name: General Narco - "Return Of The General" 12"
description:
General Narco has returned! Rumoured to have gone AWOL in 1998, he has infact been working deep cover as a secret agent in the ongoing global war against B.L.A.N.D (Boring Lacklustre American Noodley Dubstep). Locked away in his underground bunker with nothing but weapons grade narcotics and his trusty sampler, he has emerged with these 2 massive jungle/drum & bass rollers, ready to once again wage war on the frontline.

"Inna The Dance" finds a rare soundboy anthem getting a shot of high calibre DnB in the arm, whilst "Ironside" sounds the alarm for some serious dancefloor warfare - let's roll! Whilst the true identity of the General remains a closely guarded secret, many say he can be found unleashing sonic bombs and bouncing like a loon on stage with his army of dub weaponries at many festivals throughout Europe during the summer.

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F9237198&auto_play=false&show_artwork=true&color=ff7700"></iframe>

name: Mr Benn "Shake A Leg" LP/CD
description: The long awaited debut album from Bristol producer Mr Benn, featuring a who's who of reggae old & new - from mic veterans such as Top Cat, Tenor Fly and The Ragga Twins to new school talent like Serocee, Eva Lazarus, Nanci Correia and Peppery. 11 tracks of bumping, boggling, waist-winding dancehall goodness! But don't just take our word for it... "Mr Benn is one of, if not THE finest of the new breed of reggae producers from the UK" Daddy G (Massive Attack) "One of the best reggae records to come out of England for years. 9/10" Shout4music.com "From party reggae to driving roots tunes, this album is a superbly well rounded collection of music that always keeps the dancefloor in mind. Well worth the wait!" Trap Magazine “5/5 - doesn't get much better!" Barry Ashworth (Dub Pistols) "Man like Missa Benn bussa big selection to a soundbwoy head. Nuff riddims. Maaaad ting" Esther Rantzen (BBC Radio 2)

name: Mr Benn - "Rising Star" EXCLUSIVE LIMITED EDITION 12"
description: Super limited edition coloured vinyl 12" copy of Mr Benn's new single "Rising Star" featuring Serocee. Hand stamped limited edition of 50 bright orange coloured vinyl. Comes in a hand painted card sleeve* based on an original design by David Cox. Also includes a 12" x 12" colour print of the original artwork and a sticker. Features original, King Yoof & Tomb Crew remixes. Hand numbered limited edition of 50 - never to be repressed! * each item is unique, with varying colours used so yours may not necesarily be exactly the same as that pictured. All items to be sent recorded delivery/international signed for. Rising Star - Mr Benn ft Serocee by NICEUPrecords

name: Jstar - "Licensed Plates" LP/CD
description:
Superb compilation celebrating 10 years of Jstar's productions, this album finds 12 bass heavy remixes & versions (all legit we may add!) including reggae re-workings of Madness, DJ Vadim, The Unlimiters, Resonators. The Black Seeds, Tenor Fly and more get the Jstar treatment.

Double LP (with free download code and stickers) and CD

name: Record Store Day 2013 Dubplate
description: For Record Store Day 2013 NICE UP! are serving up a fat plate of dub for all the vinyl enthusiasts out there. Containing 2 tracks that have only previously been available in a digital format, this dubplate special is heavy on the bass especially for DJs. First up, Scottish bassbin-botherers Mungo's Hi Fi rework the classic "On A Dubstep Tip" in a dancefloor devastating style - possibly one of their heaviest remixes to date! Over on the flip, recent single "Rising Star" by Bristol's Mr Benn gets a deep and dubby remix from Jstar, leaving just about enough of Serocee's vocal in the mix! Hand stamped limited edition of 500 copies. NICE UP! Dubplate 01 by NICEUPrecords

name: 10th Birthday Tshirt WHT
description:
NICE UP! 10th Birthday line up tshirt. 

Produced exclusively for out 10th birthday party, designed in the classic list design, it displays the full line up for our event commemorating 10 years of throwing parties!

name: TUN UP! Tshirt
description:
Fresh from Germany's Soulforce crew comes this hype new tshirt emblazoned with a massive "TUN UP!" on the chest. We're the only UK stockists of these, so be quick if you wanna tun up yah thing a little!

Pre-shrunk 100% ring spun cotton.

name: Mr Benn ft Serocee - "Rising Star" 12"
description: Bristol’s Mr Benn makes his debut on Nice Up! in anticipation of his soon-come full length album. Toddla T’s main hype man and dancehall don Serocee steps up on this, a heavy reggae / dubstep style track which he takes even deeper with tales of poverty, police brutality and torture, but managing to triumph over all – possibly one of his most introspective vocals to date. Remixes come from fellow rising star King Yoof whose ‘Back To Hackney’ EP on Sub Slayers set the bar for the jungle-breaks or ‘140 jungle’ sound – which he showcases perfectly here with some chopped amens, heavy bass and old school flavour. Next up Tomb Crew give the track a UK Funky style re-dub, lacing it with a haunting melody line and screwed up vocal chops. Rising Star - Mr Benn ft Serocee by NICEUPrecords

name: V/A - Spiky Dread
description: Fantastic compilation of punky reggae and post-dub punk from NICE UP! cohort Wrongtom & Ed Zed. 14 tracks of well researched and painstakingly licensed rare and obscure tracks exploring the connection between punk and reggae from 1978-1984. Featuring tracks from The Slits, Bad Brains, Ruts DC and much more. Highly recommended! Double vinyl LP & CD Spiky Dread: Issue One (album teaser) by wrongtom

name: London Posse LDN Cap BLUE with WHITE logo
description:
Represent your ends with this striking LDN logo flexfit cap courtesy of Rodney P. Also has "London Posse" written on the back. 

Size is S-M but flexifit, so will stretch to fit most heads.

87% Acrylic
11% Wool
2% Spandex

Brand new with tags, shipped in a box to retain the shape of the hat.

Posted Recorded Delivery or 'International Signed For'.

name: Royal Ascot - Monkey Mafia
description:
The legendary Monkey Mafia return on NICE UP! records, with the firing "Royal Ascot". Featuring a remix from Bristol rising star Mr Benn plus an exclusive acapella.

This is a cut Major Lazer would rock at Carnival. A home banker. 9/10  - DJ Mag

Skankin! Love it! - Rob Da Bank (BBC Radio One/Bestival)

Its been a long time coming, but worth the wait. Monkey Mafia are back believe the hype! - Barry Ashworth (Dub Pistols)


7" vinyl, full colour sleeve.

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F1568238%3Fsecret_token%3Ds-LM5Ex&show_artwork=true&secret_url=true"></iframe>

name: NICE UP! Oyster/Credit Card wallet
description:
Produced to mark our 9th Birthday at The Big Chill House, these credit card sized wallets were given away to people who came on the night. We have a very limited amount still available.

Black plastic wallet emblazoned with the NICE UP! logo, you can touch in and out in style!

***FREE with any order over £20***

name: Sofa - The Nextmen feat Pupa Jim
description:
The Nextmen need hardly any introduction these days. Mixtape legends, badboy producers, guaranteed party rockers and some would go as far as to say a national institution, there is not a dancefloor that these boys have not smashed in their time. Even your grandma loves them, probably. From hip hop, dubstep, drum and bass to house, electro and disco, there's not a genre the guys won't dabble in, so it's great to see them delve into their reggae influences for this debut release on NICE UP!

Featuring french MC Pupajim (probably best known for "I Am A Robot" and "International Farmer"), the boys loop up a bumpin reggae beat with more than enough bounce to get the laziest of arses off their sofa and onto the dancefloor for a skank. With a version on the flip and a handful of digital remixes to choose from, this should be booming out of a speaker near you soon.

Tracklist
A: Sofa
B: Sofa version

name: On A Dubstep Tip - Adam Prescott featuring Dynamite MC & Jah Screechie
description:
Possibly one of the biggest tunes to step out of the NICE UP! camp - from new signing and dubstep star in waiting Adam Prescott. Having received serious rotation from Mistajam and Ras Kwame on the radio, as well as heavy support from the likes of Skream, Hatcha, N-type and Jakes, the label wasted no time in snapping up "On A Dubstep Tip", an inspired reworking of SL2's rave anthem. Featuring Dynamite MC reliving his rave-hood on the mic alongside Jah Screechy who penned the original sample source "Walk & Skank", this is sure to blow the roof at any dance.

On the Bside, Adam shows off his knowledge and love of reggae with updated reworks of classics from some of the most timeless voices in the genre.

Tracklist
A: On A Dubstep Tip
B1: Dennis
B2: Don't Say No
